In modern usage a camisole or cami is a loose-fitting sleeveless woman's undergarment which covers the top part of the body but is shorter than a chemise. A camisole normally extends to the waist but is sometimes cropped to expose the midriff, or extended to cover the entire pelvic region. Camisoles are manufactured from light materials, commonly cotton-based, occasionally satin or silk, or stretch fabrics such as lycra, nylon, or spandex. A camisole typically has thin "spaghetti straps" and can be worn over a brassiere or without one. Since 1989, some camisoles have come with a built-in underwire bra or other support which eliminates the need for a bra among those who prefer one. Recently, camisoles have been known to be used as outerwear. A variety of sleeveless body shaping undergarments have been derived from the camisole shape, offering medium control of the bust, waist and/or abdomen. Our focus is on great fitting fashionable cute designs. A camisole is a sleeveless undergarment for women, normally extending to the waist. The camisole is usually made of satin, nylon, or cotton. In modern usage a camisole or cami is a loose-fitting sleeveless woman's undergarment which covers the top part of the body but is shorter than a chemise. A camisole normally extends to the waist but is sometimes cropped to expose the midriff, or extended to cover the entire pelvic region. Camisoles are manufactured from light materials, commonly cotton-based, occasionally satin or silk, or stretch fabrics such as lycra, nylon, or spandex. A camisole typically has thin "spaghetti straps" and can be worn over a brassiere or without one. Since 1989, some camisoles have come with a built-in underwire bra or other support which eliminates the need for a bra among those who prefer one. Recently, camisoles have been known to be used as outerwear. A variety of sleeveless body shaping undergarments have been derived from the camisole shape, offering medium control of the bust, waist and/or abdomen. Our focus is on great fitting fashionable cute designs. A camisole is a sleeveless undergarment for women, normally extending to the waist. The camisole is usually made of satin, nylon, or cotton. In modern usage a camisole or cami is a loose-fitting sleeveless woman's undergarment which covers the top part of the body but is shorter than a chemise. A camisole normally extends to the waist but is sometimes cropped to expose the midriff, or extended to cover the entire pelvic region. Camisoles are manufactured from light materials, commonly cotton-based, occasionally satin or silk, or stretch fabrics such as lycra, nylon, or spandex. A camisole typically has thin "spaghetti straps" and can be worn over a brassiere or without one. Since 1989, some camisoles have come with a built-in underwire bra or other support which eliminates the need for a bra among those who prefer one. Recently, camisoles have been known to be used as outerwear. A variety of sleeveless body shaping undergarments have been derived from the camisole shape, offering medium control of the bust, waist and/or abdomen. Such control camisoles are the most casual of shaping garments, covering the torso from above the chest to at or below the waist.

user_data.target_needs: I wanted to fulfill the need for comfortable, high-quality clothing that is reliable for everyday use and specific activities like golfing.
purchase_reason: I was looking for affordable and comfortable everyday clothing that I could rely on. The consistent sizing and focus on quality were important factors for me, as I wanted something that would fit well and last over time.

I needed clothing that was not only comfortable but also offered good value for money. The emphasis on customer feedback and the promise of high quality and longevity influenced my decision, as I wanted to ensure I was making a wise investment.

I was specifically looking for golf shorts that provided comfort and functionality, such as sun protection and moisture-wicking fabric. The classic cut and performance features were key attributes that met my needs for a day on the course.
user_data.general_preference: I generally prefer clothing that fits well, is comfortable, and offers versatility for different occasions. I value features such as stretchable materials that allow for ease of movement, classic styles that can transition from casual to more formal settings, and high-quality construction that ensures durability. Additionally, I appreciate items that are easy to care for, such as those that are machine washable or wrinkle-free. On the other hand, I tend to dislike items that do not fit properly or are of poor quality, as well as those that lack comfort or practicality in their design.
